name: py-numpy
description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-cython
dependencies.description: The Cython compiler for writing C extensions for the Python language.

dependencies.name: blas
dependencies.description: IBM's Engineering and Scientific Subroutine Library (ESSL).

dependencies.name: lapack
dependencies.description: A BLAS and LAPACK wrapper library with runtime exchangable backends

dependencies.name: py-nose
dependencies.description:
nose extends the test loading and running features of unittest, making
it easier to write, find and run tests.

dependencies.name: py-pytest
dependencies.description: pytest: simple powerful testing with Python.

dependencies.name: py-hypothesis
dependencies.description: A library for property based testing.

dependent_to.name: py-nc-time-axis
dependent_to.description: cftime support for matplotlib axis.

dependent_to.name: py-pybedtools
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper -- and more -- for Aaron Quinlan's BEDTools

dependent_to.name: py-syned
dependent_to.description:
A python library to define the components of a synchrotron beamline and
their positions. They can be read/write to json files. It is used by
OASYS as a common tool to define sources and optical systems that are
then exported to the different add-ons.

dependent_to.name: geopm
dependent_to.description:
GEOPM is an extensible power management framework targeting HPC. The
GEOPM package provides libgeopm, libgeopmpolicy and applications
geopmctl and geopmpolicy, as well as tools for postprocessing. GEOPM is
designed to be extended for new control algorithms and new hardware
power management features via its plugin infrastructure. Note: GEOPM
interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs). For
propper usage make sure MSRs are made available directly or via the msr-
safe kernel module by your administrator.

dependent_to.name: py-pysolar
dependent_to.description:
Pysolar is a collection of Python libraries for simulating the
irradiation of any point on earth by the sun. It includes code for
extremely precise ephemeris calculations, and more.

dependent_to.name: py-torchvision
dependent_to.description:
The torchvision package consists of popular datasets, model
architectures, and common image transformations for computer vision.

dependent_to.name: py-pytools
dependent_to.description: A collection of tools for Python

dependent_to.name: py-faststructure
dependent_to.description:
FastStructure is a fast algorithm for inferring population structure
from large SNP genotype data.

dependent_to.name: py-yt
dependent_to.description:
Volumetric Data Analysis yt is a python package for analyzing and
visualizing volumetric, multi-resolution data from astrophysical
simulations, radio telescopes, and a burgeoning interdisciplinary
community.

dependent_to.name: py-ucx-py
dependent_to.description:
UCX-Py is the Python interface for UCX, a low-level high-performance
networking library. UCX and UCX-Py supports several transport methods
including InfiniBand and NVLink while still using traditional networking
protocols like TCP.

dependent_to.name: py-seriate
dependent_to.description:
This is a Python implementation of Seriation algorithm. Seriation is an
approach for ordering elements in a set so that the sum of the
sequential pairwise distances is minimal. We state this task as a
Travelling Salesman Problem (TSP) and leverage the powerful Google's or-
tools to do heavy-lifting. Since TSP is NP-hard, it is not possible to
calculate the precise solution for a big number of elements. However,
the or-tools' heuristics work very well in practice, and they are used
in e.g. Google Maps.

dependent_to.name: py-biopandas
dependent_to.description: Working with molecular structures in pandas DataFrames

dependent_to.name: py-datasets
dependent_to.description:
Datasets is a lightweight library providing two main features: one-line
dataloaders for many public datasets and efficient data pre-processing.

dependent_to.name: py-torchmeta
dependent_to.description:
A collection of extensions and data-loaders for few-shot learning &
meta-learning in PyTorch. Torchmeta contains popular meta-learning
benchmarks, fully compatible with both torchvision and PyTorch's
DataLoader.

dependent_to.name: py-devlib
dependent_to.description: Library for interaction with and instrumentation of remote devices.

dependent_to.name: vigra
dependent_to.description:
VIGRA stands for "Vision with Generic Algorithms". It's an image
processing and analysis library that puts its main emphasis on
customizable algorithms and data structures

dependent_to.name: py-mayavi
dependent_to.description: Mayavi: 3D visualization of scientific data in Python.

dependent_to.name: nlopt
dependent_to.description:
NLopt is a free/open-source library for nonlinear optimization,
providing a common interface for a number of different free optimization
routines available online as well as original implementations of various
other algorithms.

dependent_to.name: psi4
dependent_to.description:
Psi4 is an open-source suite of ab initio quantum chemistry programs
designed for efficient, high-accuracy simulations of a variety of
molecular properties.

dependent_to.name: py-crispresso
dependent_to.description:
Software pipeline for the analysis of CRISPR-Cas9 genome editing
outcomes from deep sequencing data.

dependent_to.name: py-cclib
dependent_to.description:
Open source library for parsing and interpreting the results of
computational chemistry packages

dependent_to.name: py-asdf
dependent_to.description:
The Advanced Scientific Data Format (ASDF) is a next-generation
interchange format for scientific data. This package contains the Python
implementation of the ASDF Standard.

dependent_to.name: bart
dependent_to.description: BART: Toolbox for Computational Magnetic Resonance Imaging

dependent_to.name: py-snuggs
dependent_to.description: Snuggs are s-expressions for Numpy

dependent_to.name: py-pygeos
dependent_to.description:
PyGEOS is a C/Python library with vectorized geometry functions. The
geometry operations are done in the open-source geometry library GEOS.
PyGEOS wraps these operations in NumPy ufuncs providing a performance
improvement when operating on arrays of geometries.

dependent_to.name: rdkit
dependent_to.description:
RDKit is a collection of cheminformatics and machine-learning software
written in C++ and Python.

dependent_to.name: vapor
dependent_to.description:
VAPOR is the Visualization and Analysis Platform for Ocean, Atmosphere,
and Solar Researchers. VAPOR provides an interactive 3D visualization
environment that can also produce animations and still frame images.

dependent_to.name: py-torchfile
dependent_to.description:
Mostly direct port of the torch7 Lua and C serialization implementation
to Python, depending only on numpy (and the standard library: array and
struct). Sharing of objects including torch.Tensors is preserved.

dependent_to.name: py-pycbc
dependent_to.description:
PyCBC is a software package used to explore astrophysical sources of
gravitational waves. It contains algorithms to analyze gravitational-
wave data from the LIGO and Virgo detectors, detect coalescing compact
binaries, and measure the astrophysical parameters of detected sources.
PyCBC was used in the first direct detection of gravitational waves and
is used in the flagship analysis of LIGO and Virgo data.

dependent_to.name: py-pipits
dependent_to.description: Automated pipeline for analyses of fungal ITS from the Illumina

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)

dependent_to.name: py-elephant
dependent_to.description: Elephant is a package for analysis of electrophysiology data in Python

dependent_to.name: py-pydicom
dependent_to.description:
Pure python package for DICOM medical file reading and writing pydicom
is a pure Python package for working with DICOM files. It lets you read,
modify and write DICOM data in an easy "pythonic" way.

dependent_to.name: openimageio
dependent_to.description:
OpenImageIO is a library for reading and writing images, and a bunch of
related classes, utilities, and applications.

dependent_to.name: py-cyvcf2
dependent_to.description: fast vcf parsing with cython + htslib

dependent_to.name: py-openpmd-validator
dependent_to.description:
Validator and Example Scripts for the openPMD markup. openPMD is an open
standard for particle-mesh data files.

dependent_to.name: py-colorpy
dependent_to.description:
ColorPy is a Python package to convert physical descriptions of light -
spectra of light intensity vs. wavelength - into RGB colors that can be
drawn on a computer screen. It provides a nice set of attractive plots
that you can make of such spectra, and some other color related
functions as well.

dependent_to.name: py-mixedhtseq
dependent_to.description: HTSeq for mixed single and paired end reads

dependent_to.name: py-python-fmask
dependent_to.description:
A set of command line utilities and Python modules that implement the
FMASK algorithm for Landsat and Sentinel-2

dependent_to.name: boost
dependent_to.description:
Boost provides free peer-reviewed portable C++ source libraries,
emphasizing libraries that work well with the C++ Standard Library.
Boost libraries are intended to be widely useful, and usable across a
broad spectrum of applications. The Boost license encourages both
commercial and non-commercial use.

dependent_to.name: py-dask
dependent_to.description: Dask is a flexible parallel computing library for analytics.

dependent_to.name: openpmd-api
dependent_to.description: C++ & Python API for Scientific I/O

dependent_to.name: reditools
dependent_to.description:
REDItools: python scripts for RNA editing detection by RNA-Seq data.
REDItools are simple python scripts conceived to facilitate the
investigation of RNA editing at large-scale and devoted to research
groups that would to explore such phenomenon in own data but don't have
sufficient bioinformatics skills. They work on main operating systems
(although unix/linux-based OS are preferred), can handle reads from
whatever platform in the standard BAM format and implement a variety of
filters.

dependent_to.name: py-librosa
dependent_to.description: A python package for music and audio analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-osqp
dependent_to.description: OSQP: The Operator Splitting QP Solver

dependent_to.name: py-numexpr3
dependent_to.description:
Numexpr3 is a fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy. With it,
expressions that operate on arrays (like "3*a+4*b") are accelerated and
use less memory than doing the same calculation in Python. In addition,
its multi-threaded capabilities can make use of all your cores, which
may accelerate computations, most specially if they are not memory-
bounded (e.g. those using transcendental functions). Compared to NumExpr
2.6, functions have been re-written in a fashion such that gcc can auto-
vectorize them with SIMD instruction sets such as SSE2 or AVX2, if your
processor supports them. Use of a newer version of gcc such as 5.4 is
strongly recommended.

dependent_to.name: py-mo-pack
dependent_to.description:
Packing methods used to encode and decode the data payloads of Met
Office Unified Model 'fields'

dependent_to.name: py-cf-units
dependent_to.description:
Units of measure as required by the Climate and Forecast (CF) metadata
conventions.

dependent_to.name: py-networkit
dependent_to.description:
NetworKit is a growing open-source toolkit for large-scale network
analysis. Its aim is to provide tools for the analysis of large networks
in the size range from thousands to billions of edges. For this purpose,
it implements efficient graph algorithms, many of them parallel to
utilize multicore architectures. These are meant to compute standard
measures of network analysis, such as degree sequences, clustering
coefficients, and centrality measures. In this respect, NetworKit is
comparable to packages such as NetworkX, albeit with a focus on
parallelism and scalability.

dependent_to.name: ibmisc
dependent_to.description: Misc. reusable utilities used by IceBin.

dependent_to.name: py-xdot
dependent_to.description:
xdot.py is an interactive viewer for graphs written in Graphviz's dot
language.

dependent_to.name: py-anuga
dependent_to.description:
ANUGA (pronounced "AHnooGAH") is open-source software for the simulation
of the shallow water equation, in particular it can be used to model
tsunamis and floods.

dependent_to.name: py-stratify
dependent_to.description:
Vectorized interpolators that are especially useful for Nd vertical
interpolation/stratification of atmospheric and oceanographic datasets.

dependent_to.name: py-uproot4
dependent_to.description:
DEPRECATED! This package was renamed to py-uproot. ROOT I/O in pure
Python and NumPy.

dependent_to.name: tasmanian
dependent_to.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.

dependent_to.name: py-lscsoft-glue
dependent_to.description:
Glue (Grid LSC User Environment) is a suite of python modules and
programs to allow users to run LSC codes on the grid. It also provides
certain metadata services, such as the LSC segment database.

dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics

dependent_to.name: py-wub
dependent_to.description:
Bioinformatics tools and a software library developed by the Oxford
Nanopore Technologies Applications group.

dependent_to.name: py-pythonqwt
dependent_to.description: Qt plotting widgets for Python

dependent_to.name: py-pypar
dependent_to.description:
Pypar is an efficient but easy-to-use module that allows programs
written in Python to run in parallel on multiple processors and
communicate using MPI.

dependent_to.name: py-zarr
dependent_to.description:
Zarr is a Python package providing an implementation of chunked,
compressed, N-dimensional arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-nestle
dependent_to.description: Nested sampling algorithms for evaluating Bayesian evidence.

dependent_to.name: partitionfinder
dependent_to.description:
PartitionFinder is free open source software to select best-fit
partitioning schemes and models of molecular evolution for phylogenetic
analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-xgboost
dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow
dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an Open Source Software Library for Machine Intelligence

dependent_to.name: py-cython-bbox
dependent_to.description:
cython_bbox is widely used in object detection tasks. To my best
knowledge, it was first implemented in Faster-RCNN. Since then, almost
all object detection projects use the source code directly. In order to
use it in standalone code snippets or small projects, I make it a pypi
module. The cython_bbox.pyx is totally borrowed from Faster-RCNN. Thanks
RBG!

dependent_to.name: py-scientificpython
dependent_to.description:
ScientificPython is a collection of Python modules for scientific
computing. It contains support for geometry, mathematical functions,
statistics, physical units, IO, visualization, and parallelization.

dependent_to.name: sensei
dependent_to.description:
SENSEI is a platform for scalable in-situ analysis and visualization.
Its design motto is 'Write once, run everywhere', this means that once
the application is instrumented with SENSEI it can use existing and
future analysis backends. Existing backends include: Paraview/Catalyst,
Visit/Libsim, ADIOS, Python scripts, and so on.

dependent_to.name: nrm
dependent_to.description: Node Resource Manager

dependent_to.name: py-griddataformats
dependent_to.description:
The gridDataFormats package provides classes to unify reading and
writing n-dimensional datasets. One can read grid data from files, make
them available as a Grid object, and write out the data again.

dependent_to.name: py-f90wrap
dependent_to.description:
f90wrap is a tool to automatically generate Python extension modules
which interface to Fortran code that makes use of derived types.

dependent_to.name: memsurfer
dependent_to.description:
MemSurfer is a tool to compute and analyze membrane surfaces found in a
wide variety of large-scale molecular simulations.

dependent_to.name: casacore
dependent_to.description: A suite of c++ libraries for radio astronomy data processing.

dependent_to.name: mefit
dependent_to.description:
This pipeline will merge overlapping paired-end reads, calculate merge
statistics, and filter reads for quality.

dependent_to.name: py-goatools
dependent_to.description: Python scripts to find enrichment of GO terms

dependent_to.name: py-mlxtend
dependent_to.description:
Mlxtend (machine learning extensions) is a Python library of useful
tools for the day-to-day data science tasks.

dependent_to.name: hoomd-blue
dependent_to.description:
HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It scales
from a single CPU core to thousands of GPUs. You define particle initial
conditions and interactions in a high-level python script. Then tell
HOOMD-blue how you want to execute the job and it takes care of the
rest. Python job scripts give you unlimited flexibility to create custom
initialization routines, control simulation parameters, and perform in
situ analysis.

dependent_to.name: minigan
dependent_to.description:
miniGAN is a generative adversarial network code developed as part of
the Exascale Computing Project's (ECP) ExaLearn project at Sandia
National Laboratories.

dependent_to.name: py-gsd
dependent_to.description:
The GSD file format is the native file format for HOOMD-blue. GSD files
store trajectories of the HOOMD-blue system state in a binary file with
efficient random access to frames. GSD allows all particle and topology
properties to vary from one frame to the next. Use the GSD Python API to
specify the initial condition for a HOOMD-blue simulation or analyze
trajectory output with a script. Read a GSD trajectory with a
visualization tool to explore the behavior of the simulation.

dependent_to.name: bohrium
dependent_to.description: Library for automatic acceleration of array operations

dependent_to.name: py-espressopp
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo++ is an extensible, flexible, fast and parallel simulation
software for soft matter research. It is a highly versatile software
package for the scientific simulation and analysis of coarse-grained
atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft matter research

dependent_to.name: py-tuiview
dependent_to.description:
TuiView is a lightweight raster GIS with powerful raster attribute table
manipulation abilities.

dependent_to.name: py-wradlib
dependent_to.description:
wradlib is designed to assist you in the most important steps of
processing weather radar data. These may include: reading common data
formats, georeferencing, converting reflectivity to rainfall intensity,
identifying and correcting typical error sources (such as clutter or
attenuation) and visualising the data.

dependent_to.name: py-torchsummary
dependent_to.description:
Keras has a neat API to view the visualization of the model which is
very helpful while debugging your network. Here is a barebone code to
try and mimic the same in PyTorch. The aim is to provide information
complementary to, what is not provided by print(your_model) in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-tables
dependent_to.description:
PyTables is a package for managing hierarchical datasets and designed to
efficiently and easily cope with extremely large amounts of data.

dependent_to.name: py-misopy
dependent_to.description:
MISO (Mixture of Isoforms) is a probabilistic framework that quantitates
the expression level of alternatively spliced genes from RNA-Seq data,
and identifies differentially regulated isoforms or exons across
samples.

dependent_to.name: eccodes
dependent_to.description:
ecCodes is a package developed by ECMWF for processing meteorological
data in GRIB (1/2), BUFR (3/4) and GTS header formats.

dependent_to.name: py-espresso
dependent_to.description:
ESPResSo is a highly versatile software package for performing and
analyzing scientific Molecular Dynamics many-particle simulations of
coarse-grained atomistic or bead-spring models as they are used in soft
matter research in physics, chemistry and molecular biology. It can be
used to simulate systems such as polymers, liquid crystals, colloids,
polyelectrolytes, ferrofluids and biological systems, for example DNA
and lipid membranes. It also has a DPD and lattice Boltzmann solver for
hydrodynamic interactions, and allows several particle couplings to the
LB fluid.

dependent_to.name: py-blis
dependent_to.description:
Cython BLIS: Fast BLAS-like operations from Python and Cython, without
the tears

dependent_to.name: py-bcolz
dependent_to.description:
bcolz provides columnar and compressed data containers. Column storage
allows for efficiently querying tables with a large number of columns.
It also allows for cheap addition and removal of column. In addition,
bcolz objects are compressed by default for reducing memory/disk I/O
needs. The compression process is carried out internally by Blosc, a
high-performance compressor that is optimized for binary data.

dependent_to.name: pfapack
dependent_to.description:
A library for numerically computing the Pfaffian of a real or complex
skew-symmetric matrix. This is based on computing the tridiagonal form
of the matrix under unitary congruence transformations.

dependent_to.name: arrow
dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-hub
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Hub is a library to foster the publication, discovery, and
consumption of reusable parts of machine learning models.

dependent_to.name: py-biopython
dependent_to.description:
A distributed collaborative effort to develop Python libraries and
applications which address the needs of current and future work in
bioinformatics.

dependent_to.name: py-basemap
dependent_to.description:
The matplotlib basemap toolkit is a library for plotting 2D data on maps
in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-rnacocktail
dependent_to.description:
RNACocktail: A comprehensive framework for accurate and efficient RNA-
Seq analysis.

dependent_to.name: simulationio
dependent_to.description: SimulationIO: Efficient and convenient I/O for large PDE simulations

dependent_to.name: py-wxmplot
dependent_to.description: wxPython plotting widgets using matplotlib.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-instant
dependent_to.description:
Instant is a Python module that allows for instant inlining of C and C++
code in Python. It is a small Python module built on top of SWIG and
Distutils. Instant has been retired after 2017.2.0 release. It is no
longer needed in FEniCS and hence no longer maintained and tested.

dependent_to.name: py-pyheadtail
dependent_to.description:
CERN PyHEADTAIL numerical n-body simulation code for simulating macro-
particle beam dynamics with collective effects.

dependent_to.name: py-python-louvain
dependent_to.description:
This module implements community detection. It uses the louvain method
described in Fast unfolding of communities in large networks, Vincent D
Blondel, Jean-Loup Guillaume, Renaud Lambiotte, Renaud Lefebvre, Journal
of Statistical Mechanics: Theory and Experiment 2008(10), P10008 (12pp)

dependent_to.name: py-lifelines
dependent_to.description:
Survival analysis was originally developed and applied heavily by the
actuarial and medical community. Its purpose was to answer *why do
events occur now versus later* under uncertainty (where *events* might
refer to deaths, disease remission, etc.). *lifelines* is a pure Python
implementation of the best parts of survival analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-arviz
dependent_to.description:
ArviZ (pronounced "AR-vees") is a Python package for exploratory
analysis of Bayesian models. Includes functions for posterior analysis,
model checking, comparison and diagnostics.

dependent_to.name: sirius
dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations

dependent_to.name: py-astropy
dependent_to.description:
The Astropy Project is a community effort to develop a single core
package for Astronomy in Python and foster interoperability between
Python astronomy packages.

dependent_to.name: py-cuml
dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.

dependent_to.name: py-gnuplot
dependent_to.description:
Gnuplot.py is a Python package that allows you to create graphs from
within Python using the gnuplot plotting program.

dependent_to.name: py-localcider
dependent_to.description: Tools for calculating sequence properties of disordered proteins

dependent_to.name: py-shapely
dependent_to.description: Manipulation and analysis of geometric objects in the Cartesian plane.

dependent_to.name: sgpp
dependent_to.description:
SGpp is a library and framework for sparse grids in different flavors.
SGpp supports both hierarchical spatially-adaptive sparse grids and the
dimensionally-adaptive sparse grid combination technique.

dependent_to.name: paraview
dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application.

dependent_to.name: py-cartopy
dependent_to.description: Cartopy - a cartographic python library with matplotlib support.

dependent_to.name: py-colorspacious
dependent_to.description:
A powerful, accurate, and easy-to-use Python library for doing
colorspace conversions.

dependent_to.name: py-dp-gp-cluster
dependent_to.description:
DP_GP_cluster clusters genes by expression over a time course using a
Dirichlet process Gaussian process model.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfits
dependent_to.description:
The PyFITS module is a Python library providing access to FITS(Flexible
Image Transport System) files.

dependent_to.name: py-lightgbm
dependent_to.description:
LightGBM is a gradient boosting framework that uses tree based learning
algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-cantoolz
dependent_to.description:
CANToolz is a framework for analysing CAN networks and devices. It
provides multiple modules that can be chained using CANToolz's pipe
system and used by security researchers, automotive/OEM security testers
in black-box analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-pymc3
dependent_to.description:
PyMC3 is a Python package for Bayesian statistical modeling and
Probabilistic Machine Learning focusing on advanced Markov chain Monte
Carlo (MCMC) and variational inference (VI) algorithms. Its flexibility
and extensibility make it applicable to a large suite of problems.

dependent_to.name: trilinos-catalyst-ioss-adapter
dependent_to.description: Adapter for Trilinos Seacas Ioss and Paraview Catalyst

dependent_to.name: py-jpype1
dependent_to.description:
JPype is an effort to allow python programs full access to java class
libraries.

dependent_to.name: py-cupy
dependent_to.description:
CuPy is an open-source array library accelerated with NVIDIA CUDA. CuPy
provides GPU accelerated computing with Python. CuPy uses CUDA-related
libraries including cuBLAS, cuDNN, cuRand, cuSolver, cuSPARSE, cuFFT and
NCCL to make full use of the GPU architecture.

dependent_to.name: py-healpy
dependent_to.description: healpy is a Python package to handle pixelated data on the sphere.

dependent_to.name: py-seaborn
dependent_to.description:
Seaborn: statistical data visualization. Seaborn is a library for making
attractive and informative statistical graphics in Python. It is built
on top of matplotlib and tightly integrated with the PyData stack,
including support for numpy and pandas data structures and statistical
routines from scipy and statsmodels.

dependent_to.name: xtensor-python
dependent_to.description: Python bindings for the xtensor C++ multi-dimensional array library

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: py-accimage
dependent_to.description:
An accelerated Image loader and preprocessor leveraging Intel IPP.
accimage mimics the PIL API and can be used as a backend for
torchvision.

dependent_to.name: py-htseq
dependent_to.description:
HTSeq is a Python package that provides infrastructure to process data
from high-throughput sequencing assays.

dependent_to.name: py-libensemble
dependent_to.description: Library for managing ensemble-like collections of computations.

dependent_to.name: py-torch
dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.

dependent_to.name: py-umi-tools
dependent_to.description: Tools for handling Unique Molecular Identifiers in NGS data sets

dependent_to.name: py-mg-rast-tools
dependent_to.description:
Repository of scripts and libraries for using the MG-RAST API and MG-
RAST data.

dependent_to.name: py-xarray
dependent_to.description: N-D labeled arrays and datasets in Python

dependent_to.name: py-pyfftw
dependent_to.description:

scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.

dependent_to.name: py-adios
dependent_to.description: NumPy bindings of ADIOS1

dependent_to.name: asdf-cxx
dependent_to.description: ASDF - Advanced Scientific Data Format, a C++ implementation

dependent_to.name: py-awkward
dependent_to.description: Manipulate JSON-like data with NumPy-like idioms.

dependent_to.name: py-pywavelets
dependent_to.description:
PyWavelets is a free Open Source library for wavelet transforms in
Python

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-fmm
dependent_to.description:
scikit-fmm is a Python extension module which implements the fast
marching method.

dependent_to.name: py-pynio
dependent_to.description:
PyNIO ("pie-nee-oh") is a Python module that allows read and/or write
access to a variety of scientific data formats popular in climate and
weather

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-learn
dependent_to.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependent_to.name: redundans
dependent_to.description: Redundans pipeline assists an assembly of heterozygous genomes.

dependent_to.name: py-psyclone
dependent_to.description:
Code generation for the PSyKAl framework from the GungHo project, as
used by the LFRic model at the UK Met Office.

dependent_to.name: py-numexpr
dependent_to.description: Fast numerical expression evaluator for NumPy

dependent_to.name: py-pyface
dependent_to.description:
The pyface project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction layer,
which is used to support the "visualization" features of the Traits
package. Thus, you can write code in terms of the Traits API (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let pyface and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.

dependent_to.name: qmcpack
dependent_to.description:
QMCPACK, is a modern high-performance open-source Quantum Monte Carlo
(QMC) simulation code.

dependent_to.name: gnuradio
dependent_to.description:
GNU Radio is a free & open-source software development toolkit that
provides signal processing blocks to implement software radios. It can
be used with readily-available, low-cost external RF hardware to create
software-defined radios, or without hardware in a simulation-like
environment. It is widely used in hobbyist, academic, and commercial
environments to support both wireless communications research and real-
world radio systems.

dependent_to.name: catalyst
dependent_to.description:
Catalyst is an in situ use case library, with an adaptable application
programming interface (API), that orchestrates the alliance between
simulation and analysis and/or visualization tasks.

dependent_to.name: py-pybigwig
dependent_to.description: A package for accessing bigWig files using libBigWig.

dependent_to.name: py-mapclassify
dependent_to.description: Classification Schemes for Choropleth Maps.

dependent_to.name: rmats
dependent_to.description:
MATS is a computational tool to detect differential alternative splicing
events from RNA-Seq data.

dependent_to.name: py-scipy
dependent_to.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependent_to.name: py-resampy
dependent_to.description: Efficient sample rate conversion in python

dependent_to.name: tskit
dependent_to.description:
The tskit library provides the underlying functionality used to load,
examine, and manipulate tree sequences

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-optimize
dependent_to.description:
Scikit-Optimize, or skopt, is a simple and efficient library to minimize
(very) expensive and noisy black-box functions. It implements several
methods for sequential model-based optimization. skopt aims to be
accessible and easy to use in many contexts. The library is built on top
of NumPy, SciPy and Scikit-Learn.

dependent_to.name: py-opppy
dependent_to.description:
The Output Parse-Plot Python (OPPPY) library is a python based data
analysis library designed to extract, store, and plot information from
output and dump files generated by scientific software packages.

dependent_to.name: py-lap
dependent_to.description:
lap is a linear assignment problem solver using Jonker-Volgenant
algorithm for dense (LAPJV) or sparse (LAPMOD) matrices.

dependent_to.name: ascent
dependent_to.description:
Ascent is an open source many-core capable lightweight in situ
visualization and analysis infrastructure for multi-physics HPC
simulations.

dependent_to.name: py-paramz
dependent_to.description: The Parameterization Framework.

dependent_to.name: py-metpy
dependent_to.description:
Collection of tools for reading, visualizing and performing calculations
with weather data.

dependent_to.name: py-or-tools
dependent_to.description:
This project hosts operations research tools developed at Google and
made available as open source under the Apache 2.0 License.

dependent_to.name: py-picrust2
dependent_to.description:
PICRUSt2 is a software for predicting functional abundances based only
on marker gene sequences.

dependent_to.name: py-uproot3-methods
dependent_to.description:
Pythonic mix-ins for ROOT classes. This package is typically used as a
dependency for uproot 3.x, to define methods on the classes that are
automatically generated from ROOT files. This includes histograms (TH*)
and physics objects like TLorentzVectors. The reason it's a separate
library is so that we can add physics-specific functionality on a
shorter timescale than we can update Uproot 3 itself, which is purely an
I/O package.

dependent_to.name: py-pygdal
dependent_to.description:
Virtualenv and setuptools friendly version of standard GDAL python
bindings. This package is for you if you had problems installing GDAL in
your virtualenv. You can install GDAL into your virtualenv using this
package but you still need to install GDAL library and its header files
on your system.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorboardx
dependent_to.description:
The purpose of this package is to let researchers use a simple interface
to log events within PyTorch (and then show visualization in
tensorboard). This package currently supports logging scalar, image,
audio, histogram, text, embedding, and the route of back-propagation.

dependent_to.name: py-weave
dependent_to.description:
Weave provides tools for including C/C++ code within Python code. Weave
is the stand-alone version of the now-removed SciPy submodule
``scipy.weave``. It is Python 2.x only, and is provided for users that
need new versions of SciPy but have existing code that still depends on
``scipy.weave``. For new code, users are recommended to use Cython.

dependent_to.name: py-onnx
dependent_to.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers
AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX
provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and
traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as
well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types.
Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).

dependent_to.name: py-picmistandard
dependent_to.description: Standard input format for Particle-In-Cell codes

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-dolfinx
dependent_to.description:
Python interface library to Next generation FEniCS problem solving
environment

dependent_to.name: py-tifffile
dependent_to.description: Read and write image data from and to TIFF files.

dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark
dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.

dependent_to.name: py-inference-schema
dependent_to.description:
This package is intended to provide a uniform schema for common machine
learning applications, as well as a set of decorators that can be used
to aid in web based ML prediction applications.

dependent_to.name: gdal
dependent_to.description:
GDAL (Geospatial Data Abstraction Library) is a translator library for
raster and vector geospatial data formats that is released under an
X/MIT style Open Source license by the Open Source Geospatial
Foundation. As a library, it presents a single raster abstract data
model and vector abstract data model to the calling application for all
supported formats. It also comes with a variety of useful command line
utilities for data translation and processing.

dependent_to.name: py-sncosmo
dependent_to.description: SNCosmo is a Python library for high-level supernova cosmology analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-fiat
dependent_to.description:
The FInite element Automatic Tabulator FIAT supports generation of
arbitrary order instances of the Lagrange elements on lines, triangles,
and tetrahedra. It is also capable of generating arbitrary order
instances of Jacobi-type quadrature rules on the same element shapes.
Further, H(div) and H(curl) conforming finite element spaces such as the
families of Raviart-Thomas, Brezzi-Douglas-Marini and Nedelec are
supported on triangles and tetrahedra. Upcoming versions will also
support Hermite and nonconforming elements

dependent_to.name: py-merlin
dependent_to.description: Merlin Workflow for HPC.

dependent_to.name: py-scikit-image
dependent_to.description:
Image processing algorithms for SciPy, including IO, morphology,
filtering, warping, color manipulation, object detection, etc.

dependent_to.name: py-edffile
dependent_to.description: Generic class for Edf files manipulation.

dependent_to.name: cantera
dependent_to.description:
Cantera is a suite of object-oriented software tools for problems
involving chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, and/or transport processes.

dependent_to.name: py-ecos
dependent_to.description: This is the Python package for ECOS: Embedded Cone Solver.

dependent_to.name: py-awkward1
dependent_to.description: DEPRECATED! This package was renamed to py-awkward.

dependent_to.name: py-pyquaternion
dependent_to.description: Python morphology manipulation toolkit

dependent_to.name: sparta
dependent_to.description:
small RNA-PARE Target Analyzer (sPARTA) is a tool which utilizes high-
throughput sequencing to profile genome-wide cleavage products.

dependent_to.name: neuron
dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.

dependent_to.name: py-traitsui
dependent_to.description:
The TraitsUI project contains a toolkit-independent GUI abstraction
layer, which is used to support the "visualization" features of the
Traits package. Thus, you can write model in terms of the Traits API and
specify a GUI in terms of the primitives supplied by TraitsUI (views,
items, editors, etc.), and let TraitsUI and your selected toolkit and
back-end take care of the details of displaying them.

dependent_to.name: py-azureml-dataset-runtime
dependent_to.description:
The purpose of this package is to coordinate dependencies within AzureML
packages. It is not intended for public use.

dependent_to.name: py-uproot
dependent_to.description:
ROOT I/O in pure Python and NumPy. Uproot is a reader and a writer of
the ROOT file format using only Python and Numpy. Unlike the standard
C++ ROOT implementation, Uproot is only an I/O library, primarily
intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, Uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-hatchet
dependent_to.description:
Hatchet is a performance tool for analyzing hierarchical performance
data using a graph-indexed Pandas dataframe.

dependent_to.name: py-ont-fast5-api
dependent_to.description:
This project provides classes and utility functions for working with
read fast5 files. It provides an abstraction layer between the
underlying h5py library and the various concepts central to read fast5
files, such as "reads", "analyses", "analysis summaries", and "analysis
datasets". Ideally all interaction with a read fast5 file should be
possible via this API, without having to directly invoke the h5py
library.

dependent_to.name: py-pyfasta
dependent_to.description:
Pyfasta: fast, memory-efficient, pythonic (and command-line) access to
fasta sequence files

dependent_to.name: py-iminuit
dependent_to.description: Interactive IPython-Friendly Minimizer based on SEAL Minuit2.

dependent_to.name: py-bx-python
dependent_to.description:
The bx-python project is a python library and associated set of scripts
to allow for rapid implementation of genome scale analyses.

dependent_to.name: py-ucsf-pyem
dependent_to.description:
UCSF pyem is a collection of Python modules and command-line utilities
for electron microscopy of biological samples.

dependent_to.name: flann
dependent_to.description:
FLANN is a library for performing fast approximate nearest neighbor
searches in high dimensional spaces. It contains a collection of
algorithms we found to work best for nearest neighbor search and a
system for automatically choosing the best algorithm and optimum
parameters depending on the dataset. FLANN is written in C++ and
contains bindings for the following languages: C, MATLAB and Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pymol
dependent_to.description:
PyMOL is a Python-enhanced molecular graphics tool. It excels at 3D
visualization of proteins, small molecules, density, surfaces, and
trajectories. It also includes molecular editing, ray tracing, and
movies. Open Source PyMOL is free to everyone!

dependent_to.name: orthofinder
dependent_to.description:
OrthoFinder is a fast, accurate and comprehensive analysis tool for
comparative genomics. It finds orthologues and orthogroups infers rooted
gene trees for all orthogroups and infers a rooted species tree for the
species being analysed. OrthoFinder also provides comprehensive
statistics for comparative genomic analyses. OrthoFinder is simple to
use and all you need to run it is a set of protein sequence files (one
per species) in FASTA format.

dependent_to.name: py-pydmd
dependent_to.description:
PyDMD is a Python package that uses Dynamic Mode Decomposition for a
data-driven model simplification based on spatiotemporal coherent
structures.

dependent_to.name: plplot
dependent_to.description: PLplot is a cross-platform package for creating scientific plots.

dependent_to.name: lvarray
dependent_to.description: LvArray portable HPC containers.

dependent_to.name: py-deap
dependent_to.description: Distributed Evolutionary Algorithms in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-probability
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.

dependent_to.name: py-hdbscan
dependent_to.description:
HDBSCAN - Hierarchical Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications
with Noise. Performs DBSCAN over varying epsilon values and integrates
the result to find a clustering that gives the best stability over
epsilon. This allows HDBSCAN to find clusters of varying densities
(unlike DBSCAN), and be more robust to parameter selection. In practice
this means that HDBSCAN returns a good clustering straight away with
little or no parameter tuning -- and the primary parameter, minimum
cluster size, is intuitive and easy to select. HDBSCAN is ideal for
exploratory data analysis; it's a fast and robust algorithm that you can
trust to return meaningful clusters (if there are any).

dependent_to.name: py-projectq
dependent_to.description:
ProjectQ is an open-source software framework for quantum computing
started at ETH Zurich. It allows users to implement their quantum
programs in Python using a powerful and intuitive syntax. ProjectQ can
then translate these programs to any type of back-end, be it a simulator
run on a classical computer of an actual quantum chip.

dependent_to.name: py-sfepy
dependent_to.description:
SfePy (http://sfepy.org) is a software for solving systems of coupled
partial differential equations (PDEs) by the finite element method in
1D, 2D and 3D. It can be viewed both as black-box PDE solver, and as a
Python package which can be used for building custom applications.

dependent_to.name: akantu
dependent_to.description:
Akantu means a little element in Kinyarwanda, a Bantu language. From
now on it is also an opensource object-oriented Finite Element library
which has the ambition to be generic and efficient.

dependent_to.name: py-fenics-ffcx
dependent_to.description: Next generation FEniCS Form Compiler

dependent_to.name: py-pyrosar
dependent_to.description: A framework for large-scale SAR satellite data processing

dependent_to.name: py-h5sh
dependent_to.description: Shell-like environment for HDF5.

dependent_to.name: py-fits-tools
dependent_to.description:
Tools for manipulating FITS images using primarily scipy & native python
routines

dependent_to.name: py-hyperopt
dependent_to.description:
Hyperopt is a Python library for serial and parallel optimization over
awkward search spaces, which may include real-valued, discrete, and
conditional dimensions.

dependent_to.name: py-lmfit
dependent_to.description: Least-Squares Minimization with Bounds and Constraints

dependent_to.name: py-cvxpy
dependent_to.description: Convex optimization, for everyone.

dependent_to.name: py-gluoncv
dependent_to.description:
GluonCV provides implementations of state-of-the-art (SOTA) deep
learning algorithms in computer vision. It aims to help engineers,
researchers, and students quickly prototype products, validate new ideas
and learn computer vision.

dependent_to.name: caffe
dependent_to.description:
Caffe is a deep learning framework made with expression, speed, and
modularity in mind. It is developed by the Berkeley Vision and Learning
Center (BVLC) and by community contributors.

dependent_to.name: py-warpx
dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid OpenMP/MPI parallelization, advanced
vectorization techniques and load balancing capabilities. These are the
Python bindings of WarpX with PICMI input support. See the C++ 'warpx'
package for the WarpX application and library.

dependent_to.name: py-rios
dependent_to.description:
Raster I/O Simplification. A set of python modules which makes it easy
to write raster processing code in Python. Built on top of GDAL, it
handles the details of opening and closing files, checking alignment of
projection and raster grid, stepping through the raster in small blocks,
etc., allowing the programmer to concentrate on the processing involved.

dependent_to.name: py-weblogo
dependent_to.description:
WebLogo is a web based application designed to make the generation of
sequence logos as easy and painless as possible.

dependent_to.name: ont-albacore
dependent_to.description:
Albacore is a software project that provides an entry point to the
Oxford Nanopore basecalling algorithms. It can be run from the command
line on Windows and multiple Linux platforms. A selection of
configuration files allow basecalling DNA libraries made with our
current range of sequencing kits and Flow Cells.

dependent_to.name: py-visdom
dependent_to.description:
Visdom aims to facilitate visualization of (remote) data with an
emphasis on supporting scientific experimentation.

dependent_to.name: cosmomc
dependent_to.description:
CosmoMC is a Fortran 2008 Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (MCMC) engine for
exploring cosmological parameter space, together with Fortran and python
code for analysing Monte-Carlo samples and importance sampling (plus a
suite of scripts for building grids of runs, plotting and presenting
results).

dependent_to.name: heffte
dependent_to.description: Highly Efficient FFT for Exascale

dependent_to.name: py-pyscf
dependent_to.description:
PySCF is a collection of electronic structure programs powered by
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-theano
dependent_to.description:
Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and
GPUs.

dependent_to.name: py-dask-ml
dependent_to.description: Scalable Machine Learning with Dask.

dependent_to.name: py-opentuner
dependent_to.description: An extensible framework for program autotuning.

dependent_to.name: py-pythran
dependent_to.description: Ahead of Time compiler for numeric kernels.

dependent_to.name: py-dxchange
dependent_to.description:
DXchange provides an interface with tomoPy and raw tomographic data
collected at different synchrotron facilities.

dependent_to.name: py-phonopy
dependent_to.description:
Phonopy is an open source package for phonon calculations at harmonic
and quasi-harmonic levels.

dependent_to.name: py-cmocean
dependent_to.description: Colormaps for Oceanography.

dependent_to.name: py-pytest-arraydiff
dependent_to.description: pytest plugin to help with comparing array output from tests

dependent_to.name: py-gpy
dependent_to.description: The Gaussian Process Toolbox.

dependent_to.name: py-gemini
dependent_to.description:
GEMINI (GEnome MINIng) is a flexible framework for exploring genetic
variation in the context of the wealth of genome annotations available
for the human genome.

dependent_to.name: grib-api
dependent_to.description:
The ECMWF GRIB API is an application program interface accessible from
C, FORTRAN and Python programs developed for encoding and decoding WMO
FM-92 GRIB edition 1 and edition 2 messages.

dependent_to.name: trinity
dependent_to.description:
Trinity, developed at the Broad Institute and the Hebrew University of
Jerusalem, represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de
novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity
combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and
Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq
reads. Trinity partitions the sequence data into many individual de
Bruijn graphs, each representing the transcriptional complexity at a
given gene or locus, and then processes each graph independently to
extract full-length splicing isoforms and to tease apart transcripts
derived from paralogous genes.

dependent_to.name: py-petsc4py
dependent_to.description: This package provides Python bindings for the PETSc package.

dependent_to.name: py-kmodes
dependent_to.description:
Python implementations of the k-modes and k-prototypes clustering
algorithms for clustering categorical data.

dependent_to.name: py-nibabel
dependent_to.description: Access a multitude of neuroimaging data formats

dependent_to.name: xcfun
dependent_to.description: Exchange-Correlation functionals with arbitrary order derivatives.

dependent_to.name: precice
dependent_to.description:
preCICE (Precise Code Interaction Coupling Environment) is a coupling
library for partitioned multi-physics simulations. Partitioned means
that preCICE couples existing programs (solvers) capable of simulating a
subpart of the complete physics involved in a simulation.

dependent_to.name: py-msgpack-numpy
dependent_to.description:
This package provides encoding and decoding routines that enable the
serialization and deserialization of numerical and array data types
provided by numpy using the highly efficient msgpack format.
Serialization of Python's native complex data types is also supported.

dependent_to.name: py-horovod
dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.

dependent_to.name: py-filterpy
dependent_to.description:
This library provides Kalman filtering and various related optimal and
non-optimal filtering software written in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-pyrad
dependent_to.description: RADseq for phylogenetics & introgression analyses

dependent_to.name: py-petastorm
dependent_to.description:
Petastorm is a library enabling the use of Parquet storage from
Tensorflow, Pytorch, and other Python-based ML training frameworks.

dependent_to.name: py-cinema-lib
dependent_to.description:
cinema_lib is a set of tools and library for interacting with a Cinema
database (currently Spec A and Spec D) through Python and the command
line tool, cinema.

dependent_to.name: py-pyopencl
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper for OpenCL.
